attributes.additional_details: There is bluey, green algae in the  lake that is fatal for dogs and very dangerous for humans. It would also increase popularity as more people would feel safe to swim in the lake. I have seen dogs run into the lake and if anything happens to the dogs then the owners may try to get something out of it. It may make the news. Then people will be scared of taking their dogs and the lido will loose popularity.
attributes.background: If it could be possible they could maybe invest in cleaning the lido.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about maintenance of local lidos are a matter for the sports centre or local authority responsible, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can petition Hillingdon Council, which appears to be responsible for Ruislip lido, directly: https://www.hillingdon.gov.uk/article/2549/e-Petitions
